original: Anderson, Carl Axel Arthur, direktör, Borås, f. 11/9/94 i Skara av köpm. Axel A. o. Hulda Johansson. G. 23 m. Resi Svemsson. Barn: En,ni f. 23, Jan-Arta 28. — Stud:ex. i Skara 13, Gbgs hand:inst. 14. Res. t. USA 19 o. 21 samt årl. i Europa sed. 21. Korresp. i Rydboholms A-B 14-19, chef f. sv. hand:kamm. i Chicago 19-20, försäljn:-chef i A-B Merinos i Borås 20-41, verkst. dir. i Kilsunds A-B o. A-B Merinos i Borås sed. 41. Sakk. v. av-talsförhandl. m. Ital. 41, i statens ind:-komm. sed. 42, styr :led. i Kilsunds A-B, A-B Merinos, A-B Borås Klådn:-tygsfabr., Sv. Kamgarnspinn’. A-B, ordf. i IF Elfsborg o. Fören. f. idr. främj. i Borås. RVO 42, Riksidr :förb. GM, Västergötl. idr:förb., Rydboholms IF, IF Elfsborgs o. Idritrustens GM.
translated: Anderson, Carl Axel Arthur, director, born on 11/9/94 in Skara to the merchant Axel A. and Hulda Johansson. Married to Resi Svemsson. Children: Enni (born 23) and Jan-Arta (born 28). He graduated from Skara School in 1913 and from Gothenburg's School of Commerce in 1914. He resided in the United States in 1919 and 1921, and annually in Europe since 1921. He was a correspondent in Rydboholms A-B from 1914 to 1919, Swedish Trade Commissioner in Chicago from 1919 to 1920, Sales Manager at A-B Merinos in Borås from 1920 to 1941, and Managing Director of Kilsunds A-B and A-B Merinos in Borås since 1941. He was a member of the negotiating committee with Italy in 1941, a member of the state industrial commission since 1942, a member of the board of directors of Kilsunds A-B, A-B Merinos, A-B Borås Clothing Fabric, and Swedish Woolen Yarn Spinning A-B, and chairman of IF Elfsborg and Association for the Promotion of Sports in Borås. He was awarded RVO in 1942, GM of the Swedish Sports Confederation, Västergötland Sports Federation, Rydboholms IF, IF Elfsborg, and Sports Trust.

affiliation.name: Association for the Promotion of Sports in Borås
